definitions.definition: To pardon (someone); to waive any negative feeling towards or desire for punishment or retribution against.
examples: Please forgive me if my phone goes off - I'm expecting an urgent call from my boss.
Forgive others, not because they deserve forgiveness, but because you deserve peace.

definitions.definition: To pardon for (something); to waive any negative feeling over or retribution for.
To waive or remit (a debt), to absolve from payment or compensation of.
examples: Forgive a debt, that is, tell a debtor that a repayment of a loan is no longer needed.

definitions.definition: To look past ; to look beyond.
examples: The music critic loves the instrumentation of the song so much that he can forgive the confusing lyrics.

definitions.definition: To redeem ; to offset the bad effects of something.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To pardon (someone); to waive any negative feeling towards or desire for punishment or retribution against.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To pardon for (something); to waive any negative feeling over or retribution for.
( transitive ) To waive or remit (a debt), to absolve from payment or compensation of.
( transitive ) To look past ; to look beyond.
( transitive ) To redeem ; to offset the bad effects of something.
